page.title: 01Hawkinge Village and Area
page.content: The village of Hawkinge lies on top of the North Downs 4 miles north of Folkestone and 7 miles west of Dover. The village was previously known as Uphill and is still shown as such on the O.S.maps.Apart from the village the block is completely rural. Most of the land is given over to agricultural use but, because it is so hilly, some land is used as rough pasture. The landscape is picturesque with sharp hills and sudden deep valleys constantly recurring. The village has a population of approximately 1000.The houses are a mixture of modern two storey buildings (detached,semi-detached and terrace) and bungalows.there are few ancient buildings.There is a mixture of private and council housing.There is a small shopping area in the middle of the village.
